column4: hey guys.  I'm new to ubuntu.  What is the utility that allows you to easily manipulate init files?
like which ones to load at bootup and what runlevel they occur at
something like rc-update from Gentoo
if I were to type "rc-update show", it would display all the init scripts available, which ones are set to come up at boot, and what run level they will start at
sysv-rc-conf
ah
also, you want to look at update-rc.d
when I'm feeling frisky, I telinit to 1 & back :)
manually, it's license forbids redistribution from what I hear
well, its in Gentoo's portage, so I figured it would be in apt.
this is dfsg territory
dfsg?
http://www.debian.org/social_contract
you should have a link in a pm
thanks
things in multiverse don't have to abide by the guidelines, but even there there are limits
like it still has to be open source?
no, just freely redistributable. For example, sun just changed their license, so it's now in multiverse.
erm, sun's java I mean
right, ok
that makes some sense, since even in Portage, it still downloads from a non-gentoo server.  unlike other packages
similar to the msttcorefonts, yes
